section.title: Building your own documentation generator with xDoc
section.para:
To make a documentation generator for a new language using xDoc, we have to take the following steps. We assume an SDF definition is available for the language.
Parameterize generic xDoc tools in xdoc.conf
Write a program that translates the language into xDocInfo terms
Write a program that does the matching of uses and definitions
Possibly write visualization components for the language and specify which visualization to be made in the documentation
In the next few sections, we will look into each of these steps more closely.

listitem.para: Specify a name for the language and extensions of the corresponding filenames
Specify the kind of definitions in the language
Specify the constructor names for definitions, uses, syntax highlighting and metatransistion markers
Specify what non-terminals in the syntax definition represent the documentation comments
